body:
We are running a remote collector that should push to an Elasticsearch cluster behind a TLS reverse proxy. 

Upon startup, the docker container will die after printing the message 
```{"level":"fatal","ts":1508514781.8733246,"caller":"collector/main.go:86","msg":"Unable to set up builder","error":"health check timeout: no Elasticsearch node available","errorVerbose":"no Elasticsearch node available
github.com/uber/jaeger/vendor/github.com/olivere/elastic.init
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/vendor/github.com/olivere/elastic/client.go:84

	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/pkg/es/config/config.go:102

	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/builder/doc.go:20

	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/main.go:161

	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.7.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:2086
health check timeout

	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/app/builder/span_handler_builder.go:102
github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/app/builder.NewSpanHandlerBuilder
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/app/builder/span_handler_builder.go:75
main.main.func1
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/main.go:84

github.com/uber/jaeger/vendor/github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).Execute

	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/cmd/collector/main.go:139

	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.7.linux.amd64/src/runtime/proc.go:183
runtime.goexit
	/home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.7.linux.amd64/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:2086","stacktrace":"github.com/uber/jaeger/vendor/go.uber.org/zap.Stack
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/uber/jaeger/vendor/go.uber.org/zap/field.go:191

I've filed https://github.com/olivere/elastic/issues/625 for the bad error message, but would like to open the discussion up here as to whether the jaeger-collector docker image should include ca-certificates.
title: Collector cannot push to elasticsearch behind TLS proxy
